metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6637 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier do not anchor the end of domain-name regular expressions, which allows remote attackers to bypass a whitelist protection mechanism via a domain name that contains an acceptable name as an initial substring.

criterions.comment: cordova-ubuntu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
